content: As I posted at https://chat.zulip.org/#narrow/channel/2-general/topic/CSCCE.20Tools.20Trial.20talk/near/2307218 I'm planning on giving a talk about Zulip in January to this group: https://www.cscce.org

Date: Wednesday, 21 January 2026
Time: 11am US EST / 4pm UTC (90 minutes)
Five of us are speaking. We're having a meeting tomorrow to coordinate.

I was chosen to talk first and give an intro to Zulip. Here are my slides (feedback welcome!): https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1Ur09MsRHOIGMvR4ub9bbPW0kiVOILxEwRzLscY5nKjs/edit?usp=sharing

I also went ahead and announced this talk on google groups: https://groups.google.com/g/dataverse-community/c/zG2Y-pDv-RA/m/-GdA3LqIAQAJ
My Zulip talk is tomorrow! 11am Boston time. The Zoom link is here: https://www.cscce.org/2025/12/03/cscce-tools-trials-return-in-2026-starting-with-zulip/

I thought the talk went well. I especially like this feedback:

"I've just joined another new slack workspace, and I'm already annoyed at it for not having Zulip-style topics :smile: . I have been radicalised very quickly :zany: !! Thank you Philip Durbin, Samantha Wittke, @Maria Doyle, and Danny for sharing your experience today!!"
The talks are up on YouTube! They are linked from https://www.cscce.org/2026/01/23/zulip-tools-trial-recap-find-out-more-about-this-open-source-community-platform/ . Enjoy!
